description:
The DNA revolution is coming of age also in the social
sciences. The purpose of this course is to introduce
students, without a biology or chemistry background,
to the basic concepts needed to understand genomics
and how to apply these ideas in their own field of
study. Topics to be covered include Mendelian
Genetics, Quantitative Genetics QTL (twin studies,
heritability), Basics of Molecular Genetics, Complex
Traits‐ Relationship between Phenotype and
Genotype, Nature and Nurture, Epigenetics, Imaging
genetics, Personality Genetics, Social Behavior,
Addiction, Mental Disorders & Human Diversity.
title: Behavioral Genetics for Social Scientists
